image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a black suit looking to the right with his mouth open speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles has visited Ukraine where he has revealed Australia will provide the besieged country with another support package to aid its defence against Russia.

title.children: Marles unveils $100m support package for Ukraine during trip to Kyiv

image.altText: A composite image of apartment blocks next to a birds eye view of a suburb with homes and gardens

props.synopsis: The YIMBY movement argues fewer development restrictions and more construction will lower property prices. But two decades of intense densification across Australia's cities suggest it may not be the cure-all they hope for.

title.children: Is YIMBYism the answer to Australia's housing affordability woes?

image.altText: A collage of front pages of the National Enquirer with headlines like 'How Trump Will Win!' and 'Hillary and Huma Going to Jail'

props.synopsis: In a bleak Manhattan court, the evidence has centred on the National Enquirer — a gossip rag with a history of specialising in chequebook scoops, true crime, celebrity scuttlebutt and pumping up Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Healthiest Individual Ever Elected': How tabloid headlines and fake news have become the story at Trump's trial

image.altText: A woman with long black hair smiles at the camera in a selfie

props.synopsis: As the biggest election in the world begins, academics and activists abroad have been barred from entering India after speaking out against Narendra Modi and policies of his government.

title.children: Nitasha Kaul had all the required papers to enter India but she was barred

image.altText: A photo of Saxon Mullins, who is wearing brown and pink curly hair and a navy top, looking seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: It's been more than a decade since Saxon Mullins accused a man of raping her behind his father's nightclub in Kings Cross. Since then she's learned a lot about endurance — and the life-saving power of pop music.

title.children: After a gruelling, traumatic sexual assault trial, Saxon Mullins says a pop song saved her life

image.altText: A composite images positions an image of Jacinda Ardern giving a speech next to Elon Musk standing behind an X logo

props.synopsis: The organisation set up to work with governments and technology companies to eradicate violent content online in the wake of the Christchurch attacks confirms it has offered assistance to Australia over its legal battle with X.

title.children: After the Christchurch attacks, Twitter made a deal with Jacinda Ardern over violent content. Elon Musk changed everything

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Don't be shy now. You think you know it all? Prove it.

title.children: Fancy yourself somewhat of a quiz connoisseur? I'll believe it when I see it. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A woman wearing blue overalls over a pink shirt smiles while conducting, in a hall at night time

props.synopsis: Scientists have been singing the praises of community choirs for decades, and they're only just scratching the surface on all of the benefits for cognitive, social and emotional wellbeing. So what is it about coming together in song that feels so magical?

title.children: 'Fireworks in my brain', 'pure clarity', 'a warm hug' — this is how it feels to sing in a community choir

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench near the ocean with her daughter in her lap

props.synopsis: Residents of bushfire- and flood-affected communities travel to support applicants of a landmark climate case. Torres Strait Islanders Uncle Paul Kabai and Uncle Pabai Pabai are suing the Commonwealth for "failing its duty of care" to protect their homelands from climate change.

title.children: What do bushfires, floods and rising seas have in common? These communities are all begging the federal government to act fast to save their homes

image.altText: A mannequin wearing a seatbelt, sunglasses and a hoodie.

props.synopsis: The passenger's goatee was "just a little too sharp", according to the California police officer who caught the driver.

title.children: US motorist caught using mannequin to drive in carpool lane

image.altText: A woman in a black blazer stands in front of a lawn looking concerned, another younger woman behind her also with furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: Co-creator and lead actor Robyn Malcolm untangles the forces at play underneath what's been called New Zealand's best television show.

title.children: This Kiwi drama divided New Zealand, and now it's our time to ask: What happened at the party?

image.altText: A photo of Khadija wearing hoop earnings, short bleached hair and red lipstick.

props.synopsis: During Autism Acceptance Month, advocates are calling for change as women from migrant backgrounds are more likely to receive delayed autism diagnosis, making treatment more difficult.

title.children: 'I was not allowed to be autistic': Khadija is speaking up about their late diagnosis to break cultural stigmas

image.altText: A scientist stands next to a cyclist on a stationary bike, looking at data, while the rider wears an oxygen mask

props.synopsis: The concept of Zone 2 training is all the rage for endurance sports like cycling or running, but is the hype real?

title.children: Testing the hype of Zone 2 training

image.altText: A woman smiling in bushland

props.synopsis: A Melbourne mother and a pilot have died after planning to spread the ashes of a relative in Victoria's north-west.

title.children: Tributes for beloved mum killed with pilot in glider crash near Falls Creek

image.altText: Police standing in a street with cones on the floor.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police is investigating after a man was found shot dead in a vehicle in Hampton Park.

title.children: Homicide detectives investigate deadly drive-by shooting in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Two images of women, one of them is generated by AI.

props.synopsis: Experts have warned that generative artificial intelligence is now capable of producing images of faces that appear more human than actual faces. So what does this mean for the future of the internet?

title.children: Can you spot which of these faces is generated by AI? Probably not — here's why

image.altText: A Fremantle Dockers player yells in celebration after kicking a vital goal in a match.

props.synopsis: Fremantle kick clear late to beat the Western Bulldogs in Perth and secure a spot in the top eight, after the Cats overcome a key injury to hold on and beat Carlton at the MCG.

title.children: Dockers into the top eight after hanging on to beat Bulldogs, after Cats beat fast-finishing Blues

image.altText: A woman in a clothing shop sorts through garments hanging from a wall.

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian initiative dedicated to providing new clothing to vulnerable people is struggling to keep up with demand as donations from its retail partners decrease.

title.children: Clothing donations threadbare as retailers tighten belts amid rising demand

image.altText: A young woman holds up a sign that says  please stop killing us

props.synopsis: Advocacy groups are demanding the government declare violence against women a national emergency after the alleged killing of three women by men known to them.

title.children: Protests against 'epidemic of male violence' kick off around country

image.altText: Walter Mikac

props.synopsis: On the eve of the 28th anniversary of the Port Arthur massacre in which Walter Mikac lost his wife and two daughters, the gun reform campaigner says it is "bittersweet" to finally see federal government funding for a national firearms register.

title.children: 28 years after Walter's family was killed at Port Arthur, a national firearms registry is set to become a reality

image.altText: A ute in front of a destroyed house.

props.synopsis: Tornadoes have caused havoc in America's mid-west causing a building to collapse with dozens of people inside and damaging hundreds of homes.

title.children: Tornadoes collapse buildings and level homes in Nebraska and Iowa

image.altText: A computerised image of Keith Lees with a beard.

props.synopsis: For nearly 27 years, the family of Meaghan Rose have been trying to prove she was murdered. Now, the ABC can reveal fresh details about her suspected killer.

title.children: Police believe a cold case murder suspect could be hiding 'anywhere in Australia'. They want your help to find him

image.altText: A man sitting on a chair with trees behind him looking at the camera

props.synopsis: He was a man of many faces but few people knew of the forces that formed his ebullient personality.

title.children: Late TV chef Ian Parmenter revealed childhood bullying behind his madcap persona in final interview

image.altText: NRL player Reece Walsh standing upright, saluting to the crowd, after scoring a try.

props.synopsis: Reece Walsh was in the thick of the action for Brisbane in the club's win over Wests Tigers, while Penrith held on for a narrow win over the fast-finishing Cowboys.

title.children: Reece Walsh scores twice, suffers from vomiting on-field in Broncos win over Tigers

image.altText: Protesters holding signs protesting against Woodside's Burrup Hub development.

props.synopsis: Climate activists want Woodside leaders to feel some consequence for what they say the company is inflicting on the world, but investor activists have a slightly different point of view.

title.children: An unlikely marriage brought down the climate plan of Australia's biggest oil and gas company. It's already on the rocks

image.altText: ding xuan poses for pictures

props.synopsis: As young people in China feel the squeeze of cost of living and social pressures, many are looking to the country's forgotten older cities where they can buy a home for the price of rent in a megacity and pursue the kind of life they want, not one forced upon them.

title.children: Xuan bought a $6,000 apartment in an old Chinese city so she could 'lie flat' and escape the rat race

image.altText: A man in a suit standing outside links arms with a woman and gazes at her, while she smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: In a statement, Buckingham Palace says the King's doctors are "pleased with his progress", 12 weeks after it revealed the monarch's diagnosis.

title.children: King Charles to resume public duties, but cancer fight not over

image.altText: Woman cooking  in a kitchen

props.synopsis: With consumers paying more for extra virgin olive oil at the supermarket, chef Kristin Bacon shares her favourite alternatives that won't break the bank.

title.children: The price of olive oil has skyrocketed. Here's what a chef says you can use instead

image.altText: a ripped bodybuilder flexes his chest

props.synopsis: While only doctors can prescribe it in Australia, bodybuilders have begun experimenting with Ozempic.

title.children: 'Revolutionary' weight loss drug tempts bodybuilders, raises alarm for eating disorders

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman through the trees in her backyard.

props.synopsis: Julieanne Hilbers spends much of her life with her hands in the dirt, planting native shrubs in her garden, so she thinks it makes sense for her body to be turned into human compost after she dies.

title.children: Julieanne wants human composting to be legalised so she can return to the earth when she dies

image.altText: A woman holding a framed photo of a young man

props.synopsis: Pilbara mother Kristie Grabenhofer says her son, who took his life at 21, would still be alive if he'd been able to access the mental health care he needed.

title.children: 'Our son should still be here': Grieving mum demands better mental health services

image.altText: Plaque of fallen soldier with poppies and rosemary

props.synopsis: Caretakers of a Hobart war memorial are looking beyond aesthetics in their management practices to preserve species that may have otherwise died out.

title.children: Untouched by development, this soldiers' memorial in Tasmania is giving rare and vulnerable treasures a chance to thrive

image.altText: A middle-aged white man in a suit sits in a courtroom, looking down with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Elijah McClain, who had been forcibly restrained after police stopped him as he was walking home, went into cardiac arrest on the way to the hospital and died three days later.

title.children: US paramedic who injected Elijah McClain with ketamine before his death avoids prison

image.altText: A woman with purple hair, sitting in a wheelchair, in front of her brick house.

props.synopsis: A building design standard to ensure all new houses are accessible for people with disability could future-proof the nation's housing stock. But not every state is onboard.

title.children: The rush is on to build new homes, but will they be suitable for our ageing population?

image.altText: A man poses in front of a service station with Mt Fuji in the background as someone takes a photo

props.synopsis: A huge black barrier to block Mount Fuji from view will be installed in a popular photo spot by Japanese authorities exasperated by crowds of badly behaved foreign tourists.

title.children: Japanese town to block Mount Fuji view from troublesome tourists
